> I try a new clean install and only put SSTU and Real Plume mod and still no sauce . Is there anything I miss?
> 

Maybe the wrong Smokescreen variant?Try using the one packed with realplume(I think 2.8.9).

>

> 1 hour ago, rettter3 said:
> 
> 
> Maybe the wrong Smokescreen variant?Try using the one packed with realplume(I think 2.8.9).

Yeah, I use the Smokescreen from the pack. Still tinkering around on what I've could missed. This is my first week playing KSP again after more than like one or two years so I'm trying to familiarise with modding again haha ![:confused:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_huh.gif ":confused:")

Edit: Finally sort out the problem

Turns out the Sevice Module engine is the one that has the problem after all, the rest is fine (tested the RD107, RS68 and D170 all was fine).

![ybpM7rGm.png](https://i.imgur.com/ybpM7rGm.png) ![t0kQGbim.png](https://i.imgur.com/t0kQGbim.png)

![e4wnoZdm.png](https://i.imgur.com/e4wnoZdm.png) ![GfItYFvm.png](https://i.imgur.com/GfItYFvm.png)

**Edited <time datetime="2020-02-22T17:39:18Z" title="02/22/2020 05:39  PM" data-short="4 yr">February 22, 2020</time> by AlphaKerman**
Is there a way to lengthen the recoloring UI to show all my crayons like in the old cfg file?

[@AlphaKerman](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/166470-alphakerman/) IDK what this 'RealPlume-Stock' folder is all about.

Here is what I use, which I know works:

![tKYhnmc.png](https://i.imgur.com/tKYhnmc.png)

Smokescreen ( [https://ksp.sarbian.com/jenkins/job/SmokeScreen/86/artifact/SmokeScreen-2.8.13.0.zip](https://ksp.sarbian.com/jenkins/job/SmokeScreen/86/artifact/SmokeScreen-2.8.13.0.zip) ) +  

Realplume ( [https://github.com/KSP-<abbr title="Realism Overhaul (mod)">RO</abbr>/RealPlume/releases/download/v13.1.0/RealPlume_v13.1.0.zip](https://github.com/KSP-RO/RealPlume/releases/download/v13.1.0/RealPlume_v13.1.0.zip) )

Could it be that the RealPlume-Stock *also* needs the base RealPlume installed?  (isn't the 'RealPlume-Stock' setup just configs for stock parts?)

> 
> 
> 2 hours ago, Jimbodiah said:
> 
> 
> Is there a way to lengthen the recoloring UI to show all my crayons like in the old cfg file?
> 

Looks like it is changeable through the in-game settings menus:

![v7moSf9.png](https://i.imgur.com/v7moSf9.png)

Realplume Stock is mod that has SS/RP plus some configs to add it to stock parts as well. If you install that you get RP needed for SSTU but also get it added to stock parts. It's how I run the mod (1.8.1) at the moment and it works just fine for SSTU as well. I've not tested all the engines though.

> 
> 
> 10 hours ago, Shadowmage said:
> 
> 
> Looks like it is changeable through the in-game settings menus:
> 

![:wub:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_wub.png ":wub:")   I luv you!

Hello there!   

I would really love to play with SSTU and Real Fuels, but I cannot find any config for the SSTU engines (the tanks are configured by SSTU itself but not the engines). Is there something existing somewhere?

Thanks

> 
> 
> 2 hours ago, ganlhi said:
> 
> 
> Hello there!   
> 
> I would really love to play with SSTU and Real Fuels, but I cannot find any config for the SSTU engines (the tanks are configured by SSTU itself but not the engines). Is there something existing somewhere?
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Thanks
> 

RealismOverhaul is the only source that I'm aware of RealFuels configs for the SSTU engines.  However I do not provide any support for either RealFuels or RealismOverhal; the folks in the <abbr title="Realism Overhaul (mod)">RO</abbr> thread might have more information to offer on how to use that config without the full <abbr title="Realism Overhaul (mod)">RO</abbr> install.

Well, it finally works with Real Plume and  seems only the the Series C service module that is not working and I'm fine with that (perhaps if anyone want to check that). 

One more question please ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D"). Until now I can't decide whether to use <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> or TAC life support. But it says for this mod there's only some patches for TAC but with <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> most of them are there, so is it better to use with <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>? Thanks

**Edited <time datetime="2020-02-26T01:06:08Z" title="02/26/2020 01:06  AM" data-short="4 yr">February 26, 2020</time> by AlphaKerman**

> 
> 
> 15 hours ago, AlphaKerman said:
> 
> 
> Well, it finally works with Real Plume and  seems only the the Series C service module that is not working and I'm fine with that (perhaps if anyone want to check that).
> 

That is actually an issue with RealPlume as far as I know -- some of their effects need to be rebuilt/recompiled/etc, as I see some failure-to-load messages in the logs in relation to some of the Hypergolic plumes....

one thing i found was if you are running restock/restock plus and real plume-stock is to delete the squad folder from  real plume-stock and just let it run the configs from restock.  otherwise they step over each other.

The part SSTU-TANK-MFT-R- Radial Tank doesn't show up in the <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr> ![unknown.png](https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/544121775575793676/686339952694394906/unknown.png)

Is there anything i can do about this?

> 
> 
> 15 hours ago, Munarmunar said:
> 
> 
> Is there anything i can do about this?
> 

Uninstall Restock? (or any other mod that might have changed/moved/removed the stock part or its model).

> 
> 
> 28 minutes ago, Shadowmage said:
> 
> 
> Uninstall Restock? (or any other mod that might have changed/moved/removed the stock part or its model).
> 

But isn't that part from your mod?

> 
> 
> 41 minutes ago, Munarmunar said:
> 
> 
> But isn't that part from your mod?
> 

The config file, sure.  But it uses the stock MODELs, which Restock will erase/remove/etc.
Hunting down the proper model and adding it to a restockwhitelist file should do the trick too. If it is in fact a Restock issue. Should be able to find out how to do that in the Restock thread.

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, Shadowmage said:
> 
> 
> The config file, sure.  But it uses the stock MODELs, which Restock will erase/remove/etc.
> 

Oh, fair enough. I'll try removing Restock. Thanks ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ":wink:")

Here is a patch file that should do the trick (save to GameData/patch-sstu-restock.restockwhitelist):

Spoiler

Squad/Parts/FuelTank/Size1\_Tanks/Size1Tank\_04  

Squad/Parts/Structural/structuralIBeam200/  

Squad/Parts/Structural/trussGirderL/  

Squad/Parts/Utility/commsAntennaDTS-M1/  

Squad/Parts/FuelTank/RCSTankRadial/  

Squad/Parts/FuelTank/RCStankRadialLong/  

Squad/Parts/FuelTank/xenonTankRadial/  

Squad/Parts/Engine/liquidEngineLV-N/  

Squad/Parts/Utility/ServiceBay/ServiceBay\_125  

Squad/Parts/Resources/MiniDrill/  

Squad/Parts/Utility/dockingPortSr/

[@Shadowmage](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/138730-shadowmage/), I've found a bug: Modular Heat Shield upgrades are not visible in the tech tree. I've debugged the problem and filed a pull request on Github. Please [have a look](https://github.com/shadowmage45/SSTULabs/pull/827) when you have time.  

And as always, thank you for this great mod!

I have tried installing SSTU multiple times, and every time the Orion capsule and other parts are missing. I am wondering if I installed the mod wrong? I am using <abbr title="Realism Overhaul (mod)">RO</abbr> but I don think this should cause parts to not show up. I do have all the dependencies installed. I just can't think of what I'm doing wrong. Any help is much appreciated.

> 
> 
> On 3/29/2020 at 9:42 PM, cardboardman said:
> 
> 
> I have tried installing SSTU multiple times, and every time the Orion capsule and other parts are missing. I am wondering if I installed the mod wrong? I am using <abbr title="Realism Overhaul (mod)">RO</abbr> but I don think this should cause parts to not show up. I do have all the dependencies installed. I just can't think of what I'm doing wrong. Any help is much appreciated.
> 

<abbr title="Realism Overhaul (mod)">RO</abbr> doesn't support SSTU anymore. You'll have to use the <abbr title="Realism Overhaul (mod)">RO</abbr> parts mods.

Anyone knows how to use SSTU Volume Container? Seems like I can't do anything with it, I mean I can't add anything to the module (i.e. Monopropellant, Ore, etc.)![I2n0JNA.png](https://i.imgur.com/I2n0JNA.png)

> 
> 
> 2 hours ago, AlphaKerman said:
> 
> 
> Anyone knows how to use SSTU Volume Container? Seems like I can't do anything with it, I mean I can't add anything to the module (i.e. Monopropellant, Ore, etc.)[![I2n0JNA.png](https://i.imgur.com/I2n0JNA.png)](https://i.imgur.com/I2n0JNA.png "Enlarge image")
> 

Try using decimals. If I remember correctly the numbers below "Unit Ratio" must amount to 1. For example, if you want 50% Liquid Fuel and 50% Ore, you put 0.5 unit ratio for liquid fuel and  0.5 unit ratio for ore

> 
> 
> 9 hours ago, AlphaKerman said:
> 
> 
> Anyone knows how to use SSTU Volume Container? Seems like I can't do anything with it, I mean I can't add anything to the module (i.e. Monopropellant, Ore, etc.)
> 

The container that you have displayed has a volume of zero, meaning no matter what you select for resources, there is no volume to store them in.  Might be an issue with the configs/patches, as generally there shouldn't be a volume container on parts that lack volume...  (unless this was something that was unfinished/prep work for life-support patches/etc...)

What part is it that you are editing in the image?  COS-HAB / LAB parts?
